jewel; gem; treasure; precious

rtega_mnemonic:
寶寶RS
宝宝		treasure, jewel, precious, rare
  • house 宀 of the king 王 containing a jar 缶 with a lot of money 貝
  • ⓢ house 宀 with a lot of jewelry 玉
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 宝)
Antonyms: 廢
Ideographic: Valuables 貝 kept in one's house 宀; 珤 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
寶貴 [ bǎo guì ]: valuable; precious; to value; to treasure; to set store by
寶貝 [ bǎo bèi ]: treasured object; treasure; darling; baby; cowry; good-for-nothing or queer character
寶庫 [ bǎo kù ]: treasure-house; treasury; treasure-trove (often fig., book of treasured wisdom)
purpleculture_tree:

    • 宀 [gàimian2] roof; house
    • 珤 [ bǎo ] treasure, jewel; rare, precious
    • 貝 [ bèi ] sea shell; money, currency
heisig_chinese_memo: The true treasure in my house is the family jewel which we wouldn't sell for any amount of shells and keep in a worthless looking tin can as a disguise to hide it.

bǎo: (графема) дорогой, драгоценный; (уважит.) Ваш
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the shellfish (貝) puts a roof (宀) over his precious (珤) treasure
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: On treasure island is a single house - where all the jewels are stored.
humanum_full_description_en:
Treasure characters oracle bone inscriptions made of shells, jade in the house Shells and jade were used for loan money in the Shang Dynasty, and they were placed in the house to signify the storage of wealth, which means treasure, or treasure and love. "Said Wen": "Treasure, Zhen Ye. Cong Liu Cong Wang Cong Bei, Fu Sheng."

Bronze treasure more than plus word " fou " silent character ( " Fou upper or sound" into the " serrata " the beginning of the text), Xiaozhuan bearing this form. Or add "畐" as sound symbol. In addition, " Fao " and "畐" are also seen in the same character (such as Chu Gongjia Bell), which is an example of multiple sounds. In addition, the glyph is only from Lu Cong Fou, omitting jade and shellfish (see Qibai every family pot).

The inscription "broom (fu) treasure" is the name of a person. Bronze used as a precious meaning, as we ︰ Ding "with Chad father had Zun Yi Bao." Or as a treasure, meaning treasure of love, inscriptions in common "with the descendants Yong-Po" in the " treasure " that is used to This meaning.
humanum_short_description_en: Treasure word Oracle means storing wealth at home, which means treasure and treasure.
humanum_full_description:
寶字甲骨文作貝、玉在屋裡之形。貝、玉於商代作貸幣用，置於屋內，表示貯藏財富，有藏寶之意，或會珍重、寶愛之意。《說文》：「寶，珍也。从宀从王从貝，缶聲。」

　　金文寶字多有加「缶」作聲符(「缶」的上部或聲化為「枹」的初文)，小篆承此形。或增「畐」為聲符。又，「缶」、「畐」同見於一字（如楚公家鐘），屬多聲之例。另有字形只從宀從缶，省去玉、貝（見杞白每氏壺）。

　　卜辭「帚（婦）寶」為人名。金文用作珍貴之義，如我方鼎︰「用乍父己寶尊彝。」或用作珍重、寶愛之意，銘文中常見「子子孫孫永寶用」中之「寶」即用為此義。
humanum_short_description: 寶字甲骨文表示在家裏貯藏財富，有藏寶、珍重之意。

In addition, " Fao" and " 畐" are also seen in the same character (such as Chu Gongjia Bell), which is an example of multiple sounds. In addition, the glyph is only from Lu Cong Fou, omitting jade and shellfish (see Qibai every family pot). The inscription "broom (fu) treasure" is the name of a person. 寶字的基本解释

寶
bǎo
同“宝”。

寶字的汉语字典释义

[①]［bǎo］
［《廣韻》博抱切，上晧，幫。］
“寚1”的今字。亦作“寳1”。“珤1”的今字。“宝1”的繁体字。
(1)玉石、玉器的总称。
(2)印信符玺。古代天子诸侯以圭璧为符信，泛称宝。秦始以帝后的印为玺，唐改称宝。
(3)贵重的东西。
(4)宝贵的；珍贵的；名贵的。
(5)用宝物装饰的。参见“寶勒”等。
(6)珍爱；珍视。
(7)珍藏。
(8)谓美德，善道。
(9)钱币。
(10)自身。
(11)用于称与帝王、佛教、道教等有关的事物。参见“寶仗”、“寶刹”、“寶曜”。
(12)敬辞。用于尊称对方的有关事物。
(13)旧时的一种赌具。方形，上有指示方向的记号或点数，赌博者凭猜测下注，以求进财，故称。
(14)喻指押宝的赌注。
(15)姓。东汉有宝忠。

寶字的康熙字典解释

【寅集上】【宀字部】　寶； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页293第12
〔古文〕寚?珤【唐韻】【正韻】博浩切【集韻】【韻會】補抱切，?音保。【說文】珍也。从宀玉貝，缶聲。【徐曰】人所保也。【廣韻】珍寶。又瑞也，符也。【易·繫辭】聖人之大寶曰位。【禮·禮運】天不愛其道，地不愛其寶。【詩·大雅】稼穡惟寶。又【書·旅獒】所寶惟賢，則邇人安。　又【增韻】符璽也，重也，貴也。【周禮·春官·天府】凡國之玉鎮，大寶器藏焉。【書·旅獒】分寶玉于伯叔之國。禮聘凡四器者，唯其所寶，以聘可也。註謂圭璋璧琮。古者天子諸侯以圭璧爲符信，至秦始有皇帝信璽，唐改曰寶。又凡錢文曰通寶。　又姓。　又叶博古切，音補。【詩·大雅】錫爾介圭，以作爾寶。叶上土。　又【?琳·瑪瑙賦】帝道匪康，皇鑒元輔。顧以多福，康以碩寶。　又通作葆。【史記·魯世家】毋墜天之降葆命。【註】讀如寶。【留侯世家】見穀城下黃石，取而葆祠之。【徐廣曰】史珍寶字皆作葆。

考證：〔【書·旅獒】分寶玉于叔伯之國。〕　謹照原文叔伯改伯叔。〔【禮·聘義】圭璋璧
寶字的源字形

甲骨文金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形

"宝"的繁体字。

Basic explanation of words
treasure
bǎo
Same as "treasure".
treasure
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［bǎo］
["Guangyun" Bo Huoqi, Shanghao, help. ]
The present word for "寚1". Also known as "Treasure 1". The present word for "珤1". Traditional characters for "宝1".
(1) The general term for jade and jade.
(2) The seal of the seal. In ancient times, the princes of the emperor took Guibi as the letter, generally called the treasure. Qin Shi used the seal of the empress as a seal, and Tang renamed it a treasure.
(3) Valuable things.
(4) Precious; precious; precious.
(5) Decorated with treasures. See "Paule" and so on.
(6) Cherish; treasure.
(7) Collection.
(8) It means virtue and kindness.
(9) Coins.
(10) Self.
(11) Used to refer to things related to emperors, Buddhism, Taoism, etc. See "Bao Zhan", "Bao Sha", "Bao Yao".
(12) Respect. Relevant things used to honor each other.
(13) An old gambling tool. Square, there are signs or points indicating the direction, gamblers make bets by guessing in order to make money, so it is called.
(14) Yu refers to the bet on treasure.
(15) Last name. There was Baozhong in the Eastern Han Dynasty.
